WRITING.TITLE: Cleaner recommendation - West End
WRITING.TEXT: Anyone have any recommendations for a cleaner in the West End? I #8217;ve contacted a few agencies, no luck...
Thank you!
Very odd, I #8217;ll blame it on everyone needing their Air Bnb #8217;s cleaned #128521;

WRITING.TITLE: Deciem store in Edinburgh!
WRITING.TEXT: It looks like there is a stand alone Deciem store opening in the West End of Edinburgh - fingers crossed it doesn #8217;t get delayed with all the recent drama...

William street - opposite the florist/gallery. It #8217;s still under construction at the moment, they have signs up saying they are hiring - I don #8217;t know how to post a picture, sorry! On my stroll home, so I will be poor/glowing...

I think there is a charity called Grassroots clothing that will take interview suitable attire. They help unemployed men back into work with clothing/training! They don #8217;t have a website, but they have a Facebook page somewhere.
The launderette caught fire a few years ago (three or so?) and they had to evacuate the flats above then too!

WRITING.TITLE: Help with replanting these overgrown fellas?

WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I honestly have no idea about anything gardening or succulent related - so apologies if these are stupid questions! I planted a few succulents in this trough maybe two years ago and they #8217;ve gone totally wild and filled the space completely. I #8217;ve bought a second trough to try and replant them, but I #8217;m a bit worried about doing it! Can anyone help me with a few questions? Big tall spiky guy (far left) - he #8217;s getting a bit floppy and I #8217;m worried he will break. Is there a way to trim his height down or hold him up? Long droopy guy (far right) - he #8217;s really spreading out and down, can he be split up into separate plants? He is growing like crazy! Large flat-ish guy (on the left) - can be be split too? He #8217;s spread over a large area of the trough. Stubby chubby guy (far left at the front) - he feels almost loose, like he isn #8217;t well rooted, but seems happy otherwise. Does anyone know why this would happen? They are all planted in an all purpose compost, and live in a top floor stairwell with a glass roof. It #8217;s mild in winter and hot in summer. We have a cat who will eat anything and no floor space in the stairwell, so they need to stay in the balcony troughs. Thanks for any advice you can offer :)
Would kill for this shitty superpower, it would save me a pure fortune in hygienist trips...
Artichokes... how do you cook them? How do you eat them?! What are they for?!

Weekend breaks involving flights multiple times a year. How can people consider it totally ok to fart out tonnes of carbon for a few insta pics on the beach? I can understand a holiday a year, but I see people flying off an extra three or four times a year for a weekend break. It just seems so wasteful :(
Thanks gogogarry! I #8217;m working on it :D
Always join the queue.
Finally, something I can excel at.

Now they know she has the cat, they will keep following this up. Rehoming the cat is her best option here, as difficult as it is. I #8217;ve told her about her rights and she will take it up with the landlords once the cat is rehomed.
Furbabies is full, but I will try the Facebook group - thank you for the suggestion!
She #8217;s going to try a post there in the morning once she has spoken to the landlords again - thank you!
Thank you!
I #8217;m not sure, I will check in with her in the morning and find out! Thank you :)
Thank you! We will call them tomorrow when they are open :)
Thank you! Yes, we will make a donation to cover his costs. Everyone #8217;s feeling so awful about this.
Thank you! Their site says they are full, but we will call and check tomorrow. They might have some other alternatives!
Thank you :)

WRITING.TEXT: It #8217;s based on the myth of Diana and Actaeon and it #8217;s my favourite possession. Pretty trippy though, and most people who visit hate it.

Finnegan guarding the Christmas tree #127876;

WRITING.TITLE: Finnegan #8217;s festive floof!

WRITING.TEXT: Yes he is #128522;

WRITING.TITLE: *lick lick lick* scritches
Depression had killed the joy of reading for me. Got myself back on track with fifty-nine books in 2019, and it brought so much joy!

WRITING.TEXT: Honourable mentions to - All the Greek mythology based books: The Silence of the Girls by Pat Barker Circe and Sony of Achilles by Madeleine Miller The Penelopiad by Margaret Atwood Excellent westerns: Whiskey when we #8217;re dry by John Larison The Sisters Brothers by Patrick deWitt Creepy AF: Dark Matter by Michell Paver Sealed by Naomi Booth Extremely weird yet gripping: Early Riser by Jasper Fforde Alice isn #8217;t dead by Joseph Finn Dishonourable mentions to: VOX by Christine Dalcher - disappointing, Mary Sue. The Binding by Bridget Collins - excellent premise, nasty abuse based turn half way through the book. Crudo by Olivia Laing - maybe I didn #8217;t #8216;get it #8217;, overhyped.

I really enjoyed Alice isn #8217;t dead and found it a relatively quick read - I #8217;d say go for it! 84K was pretty good, but quite grim and difficult to read in places. I enjoyed it, but it took me much longer to get through. The premise is really interesting though.

Yes - many are second hand though and I only get book tokens for Christmas/Birthdays, so it #8217;s not as bad as it looks! I rarely ever pay full price for a book. I also quit buying lunch at work this year, and stopped buying new clothes, so I don #8217;t feel so guilty about it :)

Audiobooks aren #8217;t cheating!! I listened to a few in 2018 when I couldn #8217;t concentrate on reading. Artemis by Andy Weir was my top pick, really good fun and well narrated. I cancelled my audible subscription for 2019 though because I #8217;m trying to avoid Amazon. I think I #8217;ll join my library this year, they do audio books too. I have trouble sleeping sometimes, I want to give them a go when I #8217;m up at night!

Thank you! I #8217;m sorry to hear your having such a hard time, but you #8217;ve still read so much, it #8217;s such a great achievement. I really struggled to focus at the start of the year, and one thing that helped me was to break every book down into sections of twenty pages or so. I stuck a post it at the end of each section and told myself I only needed to get through a section a day. Once I got in the momentum, I found I wanted to read more sections and eventually found I could just pick up and read regularly.

I really disliked The Binding, it had such a great premise but it took a nasty turn part way through. I just wasn #8217;t expecting the plot to go down some of the roads it did and it left a bad taste in my mouth. Others have given it great reviews though, I think I expected it to be less dark in theme. The Silence of the Girls was one of my top books of the year - I loved it. It deals with difficult topics really well, and made me cry a few times. It set me off on a bit of a Greek binge though - I followed up with Circe, Song of Achilles and The Penelopiad and loved all of them!

I broke books down into sections before reading and told myself I only had to read one section a day. I put post it notes on each section. If I wasn #8217;t in the mood for reading, hey, I #8217;d read something! And if i was in the mood, nothing was stopping me reading more. I started with ten or twenty pages, and then upped it to dividing the book by seven with the goal of finishing it in a week. It got me in a good rhythm and gave me little targets I could achieve :)
Thank you - I will check it out!

I loved it! Friends have been recommending it for years, and I #8217;ve been ignoring them, turns out they were right! I read it over Christmas, on rainy days by the fire and it was so atmospheric. I was on such a rollercoaster of emotion throughout it - gt;! I thought I hated Bunny, and couldn #8217;t wait for him to die. As soon as he did, I missed him, and was devastated by everyone #8217;s sense of loss. I #8217;ve never felt so guilty about the death of a character before, I almost felt like I was responsible, like I #8217;d been egging them in to do it. ! lt; Do you recommend anything else by Jasper Fforde? I really liked his style.

The Last Was a good whodunnit, I enjoyed reading it, it #8217;s probably a 6/10 for me. Some of the characters were a bit dull, and the pacing could have been better, but I found it entertaining and it #8217;s worth reading if you like anything post apocalyptic. I didn #8217;t love The Binding - I liked the premise, and the first third was great, but then (spoilers/content warning) gt;! there was a nasty amount of rape and assault in the book which I wasn #8217;t expecting. It seemed to be the only storyline for the female characters and it #8217;s the main thing that stuck with me from the book ! lt; I almost didn #8217;t finish but I pushed through because I was over half way. It #8217;s had lots of good reviews though, so it could just be me!

It might sound dumb, but reading made me feel like I was achieving something and using my time better. I never really had a hobby or identity, but now I can confidently say I #8217;m a book person, which is a great feeling. Reading also gives me something to talk about, instead of just saying I did nothing with my weekend, so I felt more confident socially and in small talk situations. It is also great (surprisingly) for getting me out of the house. When I feel anxious or panicky, I go for a walk to a coffee shop and read, or walk to the bookshop and browse.
The Silence of the Girls, Circe, Dark Matter and Whiskey When We #8217;re Dry would probably be my top four!
No problem!
I second the Expanse series!
I used GoodReads, but I #8217;ve got a journal to use this year instead (I #8217;m not a fan of most of the recommendations GoodReads has given me and I find the app clunky to use)
Educated was brilliant! I loved it.
It was really scary! A little slow to begin with, but it picked up about half way through. Dark Matter by Michelle Paver was also great if you #8217;re looking for a horror.

The two books out so far for the Book of Dust are slightly different to the Dark Materials, much more adult than Northern Lights in particular. I really enjoyed them, especially The Secret Commonwealth (which picks up with adult Lyra). The BBC/HBO tv series was brilliant too though, if you want to revisit the books.
I #8217;m with Strawcat - loved it! Such a good whodunnit. I read it on holiday staying in a rainy castle and it was the perfect read.
I think Silence of the Girls by Pat Barker, or Circe by Madeleine Miller :)

It #8217;s possibly not the advice you want to hear, but I would suggest settling for a good job and then working on it over time to make it your dream job! It #8217;s very difficult to find a well paid role with good hours and benefits which is also your dream role. However, finding a well paid role with good hours and benefits which is tolerable is much easier. In time, it #8217;s possible to find ways to do more of the things you enjoy in your role. It #8217;s also important to remember that you are not defined by your job, and volunteering etc outside of work is a great way to get that personal fulfilment while still paying the bills.
Fox News
I #8217;m sure this is an evolutionary thing where background noise (especially familiar voices) is comforting! I don #8217;t sleep without a podcast on, I hate the silence!

I think giving your cat space of their own is the most important thing. I heard cats can be #8216;bush cats #8217;, who like to lurk on the ground, or #8216;tree cats #8217; who like to sit up high and look at their territory. Our cat is a tree cat, so he has a big tall cat tree in the living room and access to high shelves in the other rooms. We don #8217;t bother him if he #8217;s up there - that #8217;s his space, we don #8217;t invade it. If you have multiple pets having a clean litter tray for each cat is also important. Plus lots of scratching posts. Play is also important to tire them out. We have a #8216;cat dancer #8217; off amazon which our cat goes wild for. Feliway is also an option, but it #8217;s better to address the route cause. I #8217;m not an expert - I am a crazy cat lady though :)
YTA - she #8217;s addicted to the feeling of smoking if nothing else.
The Gentleman Bastards might be up your alley?
NTA, but you could have communicated better on this. I #8217;ve been in a similar situation, and you need to look after yourself first. Get out when the lease ends, you will be better off out of it.

No worries! There #8217;s also one called #8216;Horrorstor #8217; tucked in the pile. It #8217;s not as well written as the others, but it #8217;s a very funny horror set in an ikea esque store. Worth a go for the novelty factor.

I have found that when I am anxious around the cat, the cat gets anxious too. If you acting worried about the get getting upset when guests come over, the cat might pick up on it? When we have guests, I always ask them to just sit quietly for a minute and not try and touch the cat. If he comes up to sniff, people just ignore him and he realises they are not so scary :) He still runs like hell whenever the door rings though, some things will never change!
Diego looks like trouble, I love him!

Light YTA You do you - if you think 5k is too much for a ring, don #8217;t spend that much. You #8217;re not obliged to. The thing that matters is that you and your fianc #233;e love the ring. If someone else loves their 25k ring, that #8217;s up to them and there #8217;s no need to look down on them for it. I think it #8217;s a waste of money too, but I #8217;d keep that to myself and be happy for them.
Have you tried digging for treasure?
So you #8217;re telling me my napping has been doing NOTHING
It #8217;s just carpet underlay I think - designed to give you lore cushioning between the carpet and the floor?
I am not allergic to marshmallows or peanut butter or Nutella. I was just a fat kid.
Ditto!
Tell that to my sisters eating disorder
A dinner my partner or friends will enjoy
NAH the guy needs some help, it #8217;s better for it to be dealt with formally.
Circe is great! I went on a little #8216;Greek #8217; binge this year. You should check out the Penelopiad and The Silence of the Girls if you liked Sing of Achilles.
The Revenant by Michael Punke
I don #8217;t know - I got it from Waterstones a while back. It #8217;s a great edition, but the font is so tiny!
I #8217;m so pleased!!!

WRITING.TITLE: Can I put enzymatic toothpaste on my cat #8217;s nose?
WRITING.TEXT: Vet gave us some enzymatic toothpaste for our cat. She said it wasn #8217;t necessary to brush, just to blob the toothpaste on his nose or paws and let him lick it off. Is this correct? I struggle to believe it will be anywhere near effective without brushing and don #8217;t want to waste my time!
Cat is two, male, healthy, no issues with teeth. Toothpaste is for upkeep only.
Went for dinner, it was lovely. On the walk back in the dark, realised Calton Hill is hoaching with very friendly rats. Hasn #8217;t put me off going back.
I #8217;ve been using a thermos hot food flask to bring soups etc No need to refrigerate or microwave :)

Yes, all my knitting has a fine layer of cat hair - adds to the home-made feeling!
He is a ragdoll :) very pretty, but so unbelievably fluffy. I spend half my week hoovering.
I saw him on the Water of Leith path a few weeks back shouting at a lady who #8217;d bought him Doritos because they had MSG in them. He was camped out just past the Warrington Cemetery I think.
I know - I wasn #8217;t up for correcting him though #128514;

The Rook is a great book - but the main chatacter is called Myfanwy not Myfanny - one is a Welsh name, the other is something entirely different #128563;

WRITING.TITLE: It #8217;s all kicking off in Stockbridge
1234 hours.... not a single one wasted!

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve found that Noom doesn #8217;t make me feel guilty in any way about the food I choose to eat. Weight Watchers calling food #8216;sins #8217; always made me feel bad about treating myself to chocolate or a glass of wine. With Noom, it #8217;s ok to have wine, chocolate, ice cream etc in moderation and I #8217;ve found that has made my approach to food better than when I tried Weigh Watchers.
Your Dad is a treasure

I have never bothered with the 1200 calories - I #8217;m moderately active and it is too low for me. I started at 1800 and the scaled down to 1700, 1600, 1500 etc. On a #8216;good #8217; day I eat 1400 and on a gym day I eat 1600. There is a slider you can adjust in settings to give a different speed level - that updates your calorie goal.

We had the same problem with our ragdoll - Royal Canin digestive food (dry) and cat grass seemed to work for him. We also got a water fountain with a carbon filter to encourage him to drink more, and I also wondered if it was our city tap water which could be contributing!
It looks like a smudge on an old tv screen - if you know what I mean? I really like it!

Cat grass helps with digestion and I think the extra fibre pads out his poo. Thinking back, we also tried Forti Flora, but that made things worse, and feeding smaller amounts more frequently in case he was eating too quick and upsetting his stomach. I #8217;m in Scotland too :) I #8217;m in Edinburgh and I generally find the water good, but not as good as the water when I lived in the country. I don #8217;t know if the filter does much in terms of cleaning up the water, but he drinks much more now we have a fountain!

WRITING.TITLE: Has Fluffy been out stickering in Princes Street Gardens?

WRITING.TEXT: It actually went up after social distancing! I was quite surprised when it went up. To go to the effort of printing stickers is still quite excessive, mind you.
**grabs popcorn**
I hadn #8217;t realised it was my cake day!! Yes, sure, roll on the outrage on the Christmas Markets :p

Yes, I agree. I don #8217;t like the market myself, so I just don #8217;t go - revolutionary! My only grumbles really are that the garden does get damaged and Underbelly do seem to do whatever they want with no consequences, but that #8217;s not a Christmas market specific issue.
No it was post lockdown, I think. Maybe a week ago? I don #8217;t remember seeing it pre-lockdown at any rate.
Fluffy is a renowned Edinburgh Redditor who hates Air BnB and Underbelly with a passion! You will come across their posts if you are on here frequently.

WRITING.TITLE: My biggest project to date! A baby blanket for my friend, due next month.

WRITING.TEXT: This is the KIYO Blanket by Chicory Sticks made in West Yorkshire Spinners Illustrious, Antique Gold. The biggest thing I have ever managed to make! It has given me faith I have the patience for a sweater, although maybe not in double knit... I will maybe trial run a baby sweater first! I think I blocked it a bit too aggressively and I would #8217;ve chosen a slightly more baby friendly yarn, but I had this hanging about in my drawer and wanted to use it up. It #8217;s very lovely though and I hope the recipient likes it! Pattern link is here:[KIYO blanket](https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/kiyo-2) And more pics on my project page [here](https://www.ravelry.com/projects/Rosieb803/kiyo)

I have a BeautyPie subscription and really love it!! Firstly, it stops me splurging when I don #8217;t need to. No more wandering into the shops and spending #163;50. I find I shop less and buy wiser as I plan out what I need to purchase each month, rather than impulse buying. I pay the yearly subscription for a #163;100 a month allowance, and I have been spending less on skincare since joining. I also really love the products, obviously. I am very wary of what seems to be a bargain but everything I have received has been of exceptional quality. I will no longer buy traditional luxury skincare because of Beauty Pie. I have dry, sensitive skin and my top picks are: **Plantastic Apricot Butter Cleansing Balm**: This has replaced the Clinique balm cleanser for me, it #8217;s beautiful, soft, leaves my skin feeling amazing. Definitely a Holy Grail. **Super Healthy Skin Deep Purifying Cleanser**: I use this when I have been wearing lots of makeup or sunscreen, or am getting a spot. Doesn #8217;t leave my skin feeling dry or tight, just very clean. **Superactive Capsules Essential Ceramides**: These feel so expensive, and really soothe my skin. I #8217;ve seen my redness reduce significantly since I started using them. I use them with the hydration drops most nights. Definitely a Holy Grail. **Japan Fusion Supreme Cream**: Hybrid gel/cream texture, so moisturising, sinks in beautifully, not sticky, soothing... love it! On its way to Holy Grail! **Japan Fusion Bio-Ceramide Moisture Mask**: Hyper hydrating and soothing, a little goes a long way, worth it. **Plantastic Micropeeling drops**: My first dabble in acid, really sorted out texture issues on my chin. Love them - Holy Grail!! When I find I don #8217;t need any new skincare, I can either let my credit build up until I need something, or throw in some makeup or a candle. The eyeshadow sticks are amazing for the price, and the candles are wonderful - really fragrant and clean burning. I have my eye on the body products too - maybe next month! The only thing I felt let down with was the hair treatment - but then I whacked a heap in to finish the tube and let it sit when I was in the bath, and my hair has come out BEAUTIFUL, so that seems to have been user error!!!! Very long post, hope that helps!

Their customer service is very good and I found it really easy to downgrade when I needed to. The cheapest membership is #163;5 a month, and you build up your allowance if you don #8217;t use it. I was a bit nervous of the subscription too, but it #8217;s been really good.

I put the drops all over! I usually put them on in the morning, first thing on my face. I use them on days I #8217;m not going out in the sun, and then use the ceramide capsules the night after I use them to make sure I don #8217;t dry out. They #8217;ve made a huge difference to the texture and brightness of my skin, and really help if I #8217;m getting a spot.

Yes - it really opened up the pattern and improved the look. I would have blocked it a bit more gently in hindsight, but it #8217;s the first thing I #8217;ve blocked properly and I got a bit over enthusiastic! Added bonus is it is a bit lighter for summer with the extra stretching!
Meanwhile, I get to gaze upon my fat neighbour on his exercise bike wearing only his underpants. Not that I #8217;m jealous or anything.
Cabbage. Any kind - saut #233;ed, steamed, boiled. Can #8217;t get enough of it!!
Welp that #8217;s my breakfast making a reappearance...
I want to go on a really long walk. Like a month long walk, maybe across Spain or Italy, or Scotland. I need to get a lot fitter first though!
Thank you! There are some dropped stitches and twists which went a bit squiffy, but I think I managed to fix most of it!
I #8217;m all for him trying, I just wish he would try wearing a shirt and shorts, or at least away from a floor to ceiling window!

It was a knit into yarn over stitch (which gave the blanket name of KIYO). It gave a lovely pattern, even before blocking, and my tension isn #8217;t amazing. The author of the pattern based the design on #8216;Chinese Checkers #8217; knit stitch which gives the same design but is a bit more complex I think.
Not going to lie, quarantine definitely helped.

You just twist off the top and squeeze the serum out! I usually squeeze onto my finger. One capsule is just the right amount for my face and upper neck, I don #8217;t do my chest. Added bonus - they are biodegradable, they are not made of plastic, which I was initially worried about. My top candle so far is bitter orange - even my candle-hating boyfriend liked it! It #8217;s quite wintry though. I have the clean house one burning at e moment, it #8217;s lovely.

WRITING.TITLE: Cat: This is my yarn, do not touch my yarn, get your own yarn

WRITING.TEXT: He likes to sit on my slippers which I usually take off and put here when I knit, so he improvised. We switched, and I got my yarn back, he got his beloved slippers.
I #8217;ve had one at the bedroom window! What a sight to wake up to.

Yes! Tapping away in the mornings, staring at us through a gap in the curtains. Not as bad as last year when we woke up to one seagull trying to choke another it had pinned on the roof. I had to hit it with a broom, or I #8217;d have been clambering out to yeet a dead gull off the roof #128555;
Is that the toblerone mountain?

I use Noom and I find it really good!! I will agree the initial quiz was a bit basic, but the programme itself is good. Disappointed to see Emily shilling it, she has the kind of eating pattern they actively discourage, it #8217;s a weird partnership and I was taken aback when I saw. Personally, Noom has really helped my mindset and approach to eating (daily CBT lessons are part of Noom). I #8217;ve shifted nearly 30lbs this year in a healthy, sustainable way and I #8217;m so glad I signed up. I was a firm believer in doing what my body tells me, and ended up very overweight and unhappy :( Each to their own though!

I just let him graze on it - he just goes for it when I put it down! I can #8217;t keep him off the stuff! You could try putting it on food though, or playing with strands if your cat isn #8217;t tempted.
That is incredible!!!

WRITING.TITLE: Coronavirus cancelled my holiday, so I knitted a shawl which reminded me of the beach I was supposed to be enjoying

WRITING.TEXT: I was supposed to be enjoying the hills and beaches of Northumbria, so took my second best option and knitted a shawl which reminded me of the landscape. It was pretty cathartic, and at least I have something to show for my week on the sofa! Pattern is Siren Song by Libby Jonson, yarn is Yakety Yak 4 ply by Ginger Twist Studios. Cat is Finn, who posed obligingly while I wiggled a bag of Dreamies at him. https://www.ravelry.com/projects/Rosieb803/siren-song
Yes!! Always forget about kitting! I #8217;m just amazed he posed so nicely and managed not to claw anything.

WRITING.TITLE: I don #8217;t always match my knitting to my cat, but when I do, the results are delightful!

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! I hope I can still get away later this year and wear it on my holiday then :)
He knows not to sit by my plants, so naturally he made a beeline for that spot. Then I dangled a treat over his head!
Thank you! He #8217;s a very sweet boy :)
I hope we get to go later this year and I can wear it then #128522;
All he wants to do is sleep on our damp old bathmat - it would be wasted on him!
He is loving us home working - he will be gutted when things go back to normal!
Did you match your ring to your cats eyes?! Brilliant!

WRITING.TITLE: What would you knit with this yarn? Brain too frazzled to make decisions!

WRITING.TEXT: Hello YarnTrolls! I have five mini skeins of lace weight mohair, 420m in total. I #8217;m too tired to think and make decisions at the moment, and I #8217;m getting myself tied in knots thinking about how to use it. I think it #8217;s because it #8217;s so lovely I #8217;m afraid to use it and commit. Does any have ideas or patterns they could suggest? I was thinking a wee scrunchie would be fun, but that would probably only use one mini skein and I don #8217;t need five scrunchies!

WRITING.TITLE: Finn, caught four floors down where he knows he is not allowed to be and protesting loudly about being told to come upstairs

WRITING.TEXT: I have a soft grey which could work!
I like his #8216;helllloooo #8217; when he spots me dangling over the bannister! And the meow and jog up the stairs!

WRITING.TITLE: He #8217;s behind you....
He #8217;s behind you.... Finn the ragdoll and a baby blue tit!

WRITING.TEXT: We have baby blue tits outside our flat, with zero fear of cats! The ultimate in cat entertainment. Finn is a strictly indoor cat, so our feathered friend is safe.
Blasphemy - it #8217;s Scottish!
You can tell because it #8217;s raining ;)
I like Goose! Mainly because if you ever get a third you can pay homage to Top Gun and name it Maverick :D
I say sausages three times! My boyfriend thought I was a lunatic, but he does in now too.

Our ragdoll has always made what we affectionately call his #8216;killing noise #8217;. He tends to do it when relaxing watching the birds or just hanging out, and has done this for as long as I can remember. He is three this November. We were googling trying to find out what the noise is. Turns out that it is tooth grinding and can be a sign of something serious. Finn is fit and healthy, no eating troubles and has passed his dental check-ups with flying colours every year. His last vet check up was in January. Has anyone else experienced this with their ragdoll? Should I be worried at all? I #8217;m wondering if I should get the vet out to check up on him!

Our ragdoll, Finn, is three this year and has made this noise as long as I can remember. We call is his #8216;murder noise #8217; as he tends to do it when watching birds out of the window, or sometimes just chilling out. I was googling to noise tonight and it turns out he is grinding his teeth, which can be a sign of something serious. He is fit and healthy, no problems eating, and has had a vet checkup the last two January #8217;s. Vet has confirmed his teeth are fine. Has anyone experienced this in a healthy cat or should I get the vet out to check him out?

Thank you! Finn does stop if I interrupt him, he never seems in pain or distressed, so I hope it is just a weird habit. It definitely seems more frequent when he #8217;s watching birds, maybe he #8217;s just imagining chomping!

Thank you! He does this fairly frequently (a few times a day) and has done since he was a kitten. He does it watching birds, and also when just relaxing. No #8216;symptoms #8217; - healthy, happy, eats well, perky. Had a clean bill of dental health in January and is happy to let me poke about his face/mouth so I don #8217;t think he is in pain. I will try and get a vet visit when we can - it #8217;s tricky with coronavirus!

Thank you - I will get a vet visit when I can, we are still under lockdown and a visit will be tricky to arrange as our vet comes to your house. He has done this his whole life, so I think it #8217;s just a habit. Was wondering if anyone else #8217;s cat did the same!
Yes I was wondering if it might be boredom. I will try and get there vet to visit for my own peace of mind :)
No problem and thank you for your advice :) I #8217;d got myself into a worry about it, which is daft because he has done it for so long!!!

WRITING.TITLE: My oddly shaped bread fits perfectly in my toaster

WRITING.TEXT: I mean it looks nice and it toasts bread! Seems sturdily made too. I wouldn #8217;t say it is any better than any other toaster I have had - my boyfriend bought this one, if I was choosing I would have got something cheaper. It does look cool though!
*My oddly shaped bread fits in my toaster perfectly width ways, please note toast is sticking out of the top so it #8217;s not just a picture of my overpriced toaster
I believe it was a refurb off eBay, so not that much!

It #8217;s a very, very wide flat loaf. I #8217;ve never seen bread this wide, it #8217;s usually half the width. I can fit two slices of #8216;normal #8217; bread side in the toaster usually. Thought I would need to trim the edges down, but nope, slid in perfectly, and exact fit!
I am used to loaves baked in tins! Apparently it is a #8216;miche #8217;. It must have been about 30cm across, maybe 10cm high.
I #8217;m glad he #8217;s back! I hadn #8217;t seen him a few days after that tree came down in the storms, I was worried he had been squished.

WRITING.TITLE: My beautiful boy Finn lounging by the fire as a kitten
A lesson not to put all your boomalopes in one basket (or stable...)

WRITING.TEXT: Yes! Little suicide bombers! I also run my colony off chemfuel and use it to get goodwill. I had too many, this all kicked off because I tried to neuter one... I was like, meh, should probably do this away from the others, and did it anyway...
Yes, luckily!
Meh, I grabbed a pic to send by boyfriend, I only thought the fine folks of r/rimworld might appreciate it after the fact.
Now done - and have I seen a single boomalope on the map since? Nah.
She is based in Granton but can travel most areas by bus. She is also out to Dalkeith twice a week so could cover out there too potentially.

Sunny Harbour has suspended adoptions for now as I believe the couple who run it are sheltering. We tried to adopt through them a few years back and never heard back, which is a shame as they are pro indoor cats!
That video Emily just put up of her son chasing those cows scares the bejesus out of me! Someone near me was trampled and killed by cows. I cannot imagine ever letting my kid chase them around.

I am in the exact same boat! 30lbs down since Jan, 222lbs to 192lbs. The last few weeks I have been really disengaged and not using Noom much. I #8217;m not gaining, but the scale isn #8217;t going down either. I have been taken off my group too, which is a shame, as I liked seeing updates. I was sick for two weeks and didn #8217;t use the app at all, I guess that is why. I really need a kick up the arse to get going again! Has anyone tried having a weight loss buddy at all?

WRITING.TITLE: 30lbs down and terrified of going back into the office!!! Help!!
WRITING.TEXT: I am 30lbs down, 222lbs to 192lbs, and have lost the bulk of that weight during the coronavirus lockdown. None of my work colleagues have seen me for four months, and I haven #8217;t told anyone I am watching what I eat. This is for two reasons - firstly, I don #8217;t like talking about dieting or my weight, and secondly, my colleagues have form for being a bit bitchy about others losing weight. I know many of them have gained weight during lockdown, and I am terrified of them noticing my weight loss when I go back to work. I #8217;m sure there will be comments and I #8217;ll get grilled on it. 30lbs isn #8217;t a massive amount, but I #8217;m only 5 #8217;5 so it is definitely noticeable now! Has anyone come out of lockdown a bit lighter, or have any tips for deflecting unwanted weight loss questions?!?
I #8217;m really shy so I just don #8217;t like the attention!! I will probably not weary tightest new dress on my first day. I am kind of curious to see if people notice though.
I #8217;m glad it #8217;s not just me! That #8217;s a good approach, with the commuting comment. My saving grace has been no vending machines and no cafe!

I #8217;m in the same boat. This is the second I #8217;ve lost weight, first time I put it back on after some major health issues. I guess part of it is worry I will put the weight on again so I don #8217;t want to draw any attention to it in case I don #8217;t keep it up!
Thank you :)
I #8217;m hoping it will be enough to just cut off the conversation! I am looking forward to going back in and wearing a nice fitted dress instead of a stretchy one, mind you!

That #8217;s a good point - kinda points out you shouldn #8217;t ask about people #8217;s weight loss as it #8217;s not always intentional. Congrats on your weight loss! I am aiming for 50lbs before November, but I #8217;m totally failing right now and just maintaining.

I #8217;m just shy, I don #8217;t like the attention and I #8217;m conscious a lot of people have been having a hard time diet wise recently! I think a simple explanation is best like you say - keeps it short and sweet! Or maybe something to put people off from asking more... I #8217;ll tell them I had a tapeworm #128514;
It #8217;s less a case of plateauing for no reason, more a case of a take-out once a week and not weighing my cereal! I #8217;m getting back on it gradually!
Honestly, having evening plans ruins my entire day sometimes!!!
I don #8217;t... I just try and arrange brunch if possible so my socialising is over and done by mid afternoon #128557;
Two social events in a day?!? Never!

Thank you! I think it feels like not so much progress because I still haven #8217;t 40lbs to go. I did kinda get how much it was the other day though, when I was carrying maybe 15lbs of shopping up the stairs. We live on the 4th floor and I was puffed out. Realised I #8217;d been carrying twice that round all the time a few months ago!
This one is on my list, but I #8217;m too scared to try a sweater! How did you find it?
Oh lord, sounds like maybe not the best first one for me! I #8217;m easily flustered. I might tackle something a bit easier. Yours looks fantastic thought - beautiful colour choice!!!

I was thinking maybe a Flax or Weekender for a first attempt! I haven #8217;t seen Brick, I will check that one out :) I have a cowl to finish up and then I #8217;m treating myself to yarn for a sweater! Aiming for Winter (maybe 2021...)
They are all beautiful boys #128557;

Hi all! I #8217;m Rosie, 29F, from Edinburgh, Scotland. My SW was a little over 220lbs in Jan of this year, CW 190lbs. This is my first challenge and I #8217;m hoping to get the momentum going again on my weight loss after slowing down a lot during the Coronavirus lockdown here in Scotland. I #8217;m aiming to get to 182lbs by the end of the challenge, which would put me in overweight BMI instead of obese. I #8217;m going on holiday at the end of the challenge, and a non-scale goal for me would be to hike up a good hill with my boyfriend!!
I switched out potatoes for sweet potatoes and it has definitely helped! I also try veggie meat substitutes for me as that are lower calorie.
I have the same. The answer is, I turned 30.

They don #8217;t - I recruited for marketing and ad people in food/drink and BrewDog were the only people who ever tried to pull this kind of nonsense. They were awful for it - stringing people along for four interviews and such. Don #8217;t work in the field anymore, but still don #8217;t like them as a company.

You could walk to Stockbridge down through Dean Village, straight along the water of Leith path. Very pretty walk. LoveCrumbs in Stockbridge is great for a slice of cake and you can walk to the botanic gardens easily and see the glasshouses. If you like Dean Village, it is worth walking through the Colonies. I think most pubs and restaurants in Stockbridge are decent, but can #8217;t comment on child friendliness. Stockbridge is very family orientated, so I imagine they all are. Hectors is nice for pub food, so is the Antiquary, but it #8217;s more pub than gastro-pub.

WRITING.TITLE: New open air market coming on 6th August, St Mary #8217;s Cathedral, West End!

WRITING.TEXT: There is a new open air market coming, made up of business from the West End. Running 6th to 30th August, Weds to Sun, 12-8pm. There will be food, drink, pop-up shops, yoga classes. Seen this advertised on the West End Facebook group, thought it could do with being shared more widely.
Yes! See I never knew there was one in the east end!

I use Petplan too, it seems good! Vet wise, I use VetKind. They come out to the house to save the stress of going in to the vet. They #8217;ve been fab - very patient with our cat, generally lovely. They partner with a traditional vet for if your pet ever needs surgery etc.
Another vote for vetkind - Martha is lovely and it #8217;s so nice not to have to take the cat in to the vet!!!

WRITING.TITLE: Forbidden ham

WRITING.TEXT: Forbidden ham... aka agate coasters I was spammed with on instagram
A deliberate pun :p my Nan used to force feed us spam fritters as kids, yeuch
I have over a thousand hours in game and I had NO IDEA you could right click to dismiss!!!

This two bed (67sq metres) was up for #163;395k. I think the listing is from early last year. Houses like these usually got for 10-20% over asking at least as they are so desirable. It #8217;s a beautiful street but you don #8217;t get much house for your money. That and loads of plebs like me are always walking past your front window to enjoy the scenery. https://www.rettie.co.uk/properties/11237455/sales
Hau Han is delicious! They deliver and so sit in, they are just by haymarket.

WRITING.TITLE: Charlie is 22 years old, but can #8217;t resist a feather (even if she needs a lie down after a minute)
Charlie is 22 years old and demands your immediate attention

WRITING.TEXT: She is ancient... she is deaf, mostly blind, thin as a rake but happy as a clam.
She gets all the scratches! Only thing that stops her yelling. That, and Dreamies.
She #8217;s not doing bad for an old broad. She has forgotten how to groom though - she gets a moist flannelling and a little comb every day!
Yes, another cat sub! I thought I had them all...

WRITING.TITLE: My 22 year old chain smoker, Charlie!

WRITING.TEXT: They are little crunchy biscuits - they are not particularly healthy, but she likes them!
She has a little heated igloo bed and in the winter my step dad hand feeds her biscuits so she doesn #8217;t have to come out in the cold. She is so pampered!!

WRITING.TITLE: I bought this hank of yarn as part of a de-stash - is it normal for it to be in this many pieces?!

WRITING.TEXT: Some more context - I bought three hanks of indie hand dyed yarn direct from the dyer when she was having a clear out. This is the state of one of the hanks. Some of these pieces are only a few metres long. I #8217;ve only been knitting a year, but have never seen this with yarn before. Is this normal?! Surely not! The yarn is the dyers own hand dyed yarn. It was much cheaper than she usually sells it for. Would I be unreasonable to ask for a refund? She didn #8217;t disclose the yarn was below standard quality at all, I #8217;m so disappointed. This was destined to be part of a t-shirt, but if the other two hanks are like this, I #8217;m not sure it #8217;s suitable.

It should have been 100g - the big ball is 69g, little balls are the remainder! She was selling it off cheap, but my understanding was it was a clear out of unused stash, not offloading iffy yarn. Fingers crossed the other two skeins are on a better state. I will get in touch with her after I #8217;ve balled them. This one took me 90 minutes as the scraps were so tangled!!!

I couldn #8217;t see any grains of moth #8216;leftovers #8217; so I #8217;m really hoping it isn #8217;t moths! I haven #8217;t seen any signs of them in my place either. I will get in touch just in case.
It #8217;s such a lovely colour. I #8217;m sure it will knit up nicely in the end! Might need to put it away for a few weeks so I can calm down before I knit it up haha

Right so I #8217;ve now sorted out the other two hanks - nothing, both totally fine! So I #8217;m thinking unlikely to be bugs because they would surely be in all of them? They have all been stored together! No other signs of moths at all - no dirt, waste, bits etc.
I #8217;m leaning towards this as the other two hanks we #8217;re fine, no #8216;babies #8217;, but they were a little crimped like they have been knitted at some point!
It #8217;s beautiful yarn though! And I can #8217;t afford nice hand dyed stuff normally, the other two skeins are totally fine, luckily.
No, it wasn #8217;t knotted - just broken. I really don #8217;t think it is moths though, no sign of them at all. No dirt, cases, speckles. The other hanks it was stored with were totally fine.
I #8217;m putting it in the freezer just in case, but it #8217;s been stored in a ziplock bag since it came and the other skeins were both ok. No other signs of moths, luckily.

That #8217;s what I #8217;m wondering - maybe she just forgot it was a skein she had made up out of odds and ends. The other two were totally fine, no signs of moths and they were all stored together.
I #8217;m wondering if it was something frogged as the other hank was crimped (but not cut). I got it cheap in a de-stash, just a bit miffed she didn #8217;t say it was like this.
It #8217;s blue faces Leicester four ply - other two skeins were fine, it was all stored in the same place, no sign of moths. Weird!
That #8217;s a good shout - the tips of the babies are much lighter that the rest!!!
I #8217;ve just balled the other two - they are ok, so I think I will have enough for my project without the babies. Luckily!

I think you are bang on the money - I have just tried pulling on the pink tips and they are just coming apart. The texture is very dry and almost crumbly. The other two skeins have no pink bits and the tips are really strong! What a pain - I will stick to my local shop in future!

There was a comment further down about the tips of the #8216;babies #8217; being lighter and possible dye damage. I think that #8217;s the reason it has broken - the deep purple is really strong, but the light pink bits are crumbly and dry. I have two more skeins and I think it will be ok for the project I had in mind! Id just got brave enough for a t-shirt, can #8217;t turn back now!

I agree! I think another commenter had it right though - they broken bits are significantly lighter and appear to be dye damaged. The wool is dry and brittle in the bright spots. She may not have noticed when winding it. The other two skeins are fine, so I should have enough for my project! I won #8217;t buy from her again.

Oh no, sorry, my local shop is an indie dyer! She is lovely, but I can only afford one skein at a time. I wanted to make a t-shirt which is why I picked this up during someone else #8217;s de-stash :)

I think we have got to the bottom of it - it is damage from dyeing going wrong. The broken areas were all very light pink and the texture of the wool is brittle and crumbly. The light pink areas are all breaking very easily. No issues with any of the other two balls from the seller, or the rest of my yarn. There is, of course, the possibility that it is bugs and they just went for the light pink bits, so I will freeze just in case!
Yes! Spot on! She is a plant based dyer! The damage is in very specific spots so maybe something pooped or splashed or soaked into a tie? I don #8217;t know much about dyeing.
There #8217;s a big green one up by the modern art gallery at the moment - caught my eye! I #8217;d be interested to know more about them.

The Stockbridge Dental Practice is good, but has just gone private only. I was pretty gutted, I hate the dentist and had only just got comfortable going there. Can #8217;t afford their subscription fee plus private treatment costs. I #8217;d be interested to hear of any decent (and patient) dentists in the area taking NHS patients just now!
I #8217;m sure Lush on Princes Street used to apply it for you? They #8217;d send you home to wash it off though!
A new bedspread - with added bedbugs!

Try looking at the West End - fewer students than the New Town, but still the New Town vibe. We live in a townhouse (subdivided) and don #8217;t hear a peep from our neighbours. Never had any anti-English sentiment (I #8217;m not English but have an English accent) but I was assumed to be a Tory because of my accent. The shame.
Oh my god, I instantly though vagina, and then thought, on no, I won #8217;t say that, it #8217;ll ruin it for OP But really, it is so vagina (well, vulva?), I love it.

Possibly a bit out of your way, but Ginger Twist Studios on London Road is a local small business with a good variety of yarn! Really lovely, friendly people. They stock hand dyed and a range of more affordable branded yarns. They have an online shop which will give you an idea of the sort of thing they stock. Not sure if it is all available in store as it is a tiny shop. Ysolda is an online only Edinburgh business and they stock some great affordable yarn too.
Depends where OP is in Leith. If they are the Newhaven side, it is a fair walk there - hence #8216;possibly #8217; a #8216;bit #8217; out of their way?

I stick a hot water bottle down the front of my jumper. Also raises the fun game of #8216;COVID-19lbs #8217; or sneaky pregnancy. You can also get heated seat pads, a bit like an electric blanket. They cost buttons to run and keep you cozy.

Not in the Newington area, but I #8217;d suggest getting a few sessions with a personal trainer at the gym you join. They will be happy to help you put a programme together and get you confident doing new moves. Either that, or watch a few YouTube videos and learn some basic moves before you go. I usually write down what I #8217;m planning to do before I go to save me from panicking and just hopping on the treadmill. I wouldn #8217;t mind too much about look sweaty and out of puff - 99% of people don #8217;t pay any attention to others at the gym, the other 1% are eejits. Plus, if you #8217;re out of puff and sweaty, I #8217;d say you are already knocking it out of the park! Good luck :)

WRITING.TITLE: Halloween in the West End #127875;

WRITING.TEXT: The pumpkins are SHINY! It #8217;s lovely!
They always do lovely Christmas decorations too!

WRITING.TITLE: My grandpa died this morning. I went for a walk to take my mind off things and an elderly man leered and catcalled at me.
WRITING.TEXT: My grandpa died this morning. I went out for a walk to try and take my mind of things. Stepped out of the way to let an elderly man having trouble walking pass, and keep social distance. He leered at me, pointed at my crotch and made kissy noises as he went past. I called him a disgusting old c**t and gave him the finger. I am so fucking angry. I was wearing leggings, a parka, a bobble hat and a mask. Red eyes from all the crying. What is fucking wrong with these people.
Thank you - the shitty cherry on my shitty day!
I know, I was thinking about whether to include it but I was just dressed so gross this morning, I couldn #8217;t believe. What a disgusting old man.
